text: was a after Reiki and before Jinki. This period started in November 717 and ended in February 724.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Yōro" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 1058. The reigning empress was .Nussbaum, "Genshō Tennō," p. 240; Nussbaum, "Genshō Tennō," p. 240; Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). Annales des empereurs du Japon, pp. 65-67; Brown, Delmer et al. (1979). Gukanshō, pp. 271-272; Varley, H. Paul. (1980). Jinnō Shōtōki. pp. 140-141. ==Events of the Yōrō era== * 717 (Yōrō 1, 9th month): Empress Genshō traveled through Ōmi Province where she was met by the lords of the San'indō, the San'yōdō and the Nankaidō. Also, she traveled to Mino Province where the lords of the Tōkaidō, Tōsandō and Hokurikudō met with her.Titsingh, pp. 65-66. * 718 (Yōrō 2): Changes in the Taihō Code are made. The combines comments with changes and additions.Asakawa, Kan'ichi. (1903). The Early Institutional Life of Japan: A Study in the Reform of 645, p. 13. * 720 (Yōrō 4): Nihon Shoki completed.Nussbaum, "Nihon Shoki" at p. 710. * 721 (Yōrō 5, 5th month): Nihon Shoki in 30 volumes was given to the Empress.Titsingh, p. 66. * 721 (Yōrō 5, 5th month): Fujiwara no Fuhito died at age 62.Titsingh, p. 67. * 721 (Yōrō 5, 5th month): Former-Empress Gemmei died at age 61.Titsingh, p. 67; Imperial Household Agency (Kunaichō), 元明天皇 (43); retrieved 2012-5-27. ==Nara period== * Nara period ==References== ==Other websites== * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Yōrō 1st 2nd 3rd 4th 5th 6th 7th 8th 717 718 719 720 721 722 723 724 Preceded by: Reiki Era or nengō: Yōrō Succeeded by: Jinki Category:Japanese eras Category:710s establishments in Japan Category:720s disestablishments in Japan
title: Yōrō
